location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Acting Resident at Bushire to Stephen Babbington, Deputy Secretary to the Government, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: The enclosure of this item is located on folios 92v-93 and the main letter is located on folio 94. In between these two letters, located on folios 93-94, are two letters which are separate from this description.

mods.abstract: The letter is enclosing a copy and translation of a note from Shaik hoo Sheraa (also spelt Shaik oo Sharaa), received 10 December 1811, which outlines the information that is available about the estate of the late Aga Mahomed Bhubarney, of which the Shaik has assumed responsibility as executor. The letter notes that there appears to be very few assets available to the East India Company in the current quarter and those that are, are tied up in litigation surrounding a ship sold at Bussora [Basra].
